meanings.definition: To cut small bits or pare shavings from a piece of wood.
meanings.sent1: I like to whittle little animals out of wood.
meanings.sent2: He used a knife to whittle a small figure from the branch.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa can whittle so well, he made a tiny boat that floats!
meanings.sent4: She whittled away at the block of wood until a bird emerged.
meanings.sent5: The old man's hands moved swiftly as he whittled, creating magic.

meanings.sent1: She decided to whittle down her collection of books.
meanings.sent2: The company had to whittle its expenses to stay afloat.
meanings.sent3: I will whittle away at my bad habits one by one.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to whittle away at the mountain, making it smaller.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor would whittle away excess stone to reveal the statue within.

meanings.definition: A small piece or fragment that has been cut or pared off.
meanings.sent1: He found a whittle of wood on the workshop floor.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter collected the wood whittles for kindling.
meanings.sent3: The child proudly showed off his collection of colorful wood whittles.
meanings.sent4: She used the wood whittle as a tiny bookmark in her book.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel carried the wood whittle to its nest for building.
